title: Is the universe itself conscious? Is it possible that the universe is just a consciousness? - Quora

response.answer_text: As far as we can tell at the moment, consciousness happens inside a brain. The universe is not a brain, so it’s unconscious. The whole universe is mostly gas distributed across space. Solid matter is only a fraction of it. The complex interactions we see on Earth are quite the exception. Brains need billions of neurons to function, involving complex chemistry that we’re far from understanding. In comparison, most matter in the universe doesn’t interact with itself in such complex ways. Chemistry doesn’t really happen outside of planets. Gravity is the only force worth considering on a large scale (with other phenomenons stemming from the properties of matter itself). Gravity is pretty straight forward. It can accelerate objects, it can clump matter into stars and planets, it can maintain bodies in orbit around each other… and that’s about it. Gravity alone can’t produce a sensory system, let alone a conscious one.

Is the universe itself conscious? Can an ant know if you are conscious? Can you know if a plant is conscious? ONLY the conscious entity will know. So, this is a good and ancient question. We are wasting our time guessing and arguing about it. IF the U is conscious, it alone will know that fact. Is it possible that the universe is just a consciousness? This is the thesis/tenet of Vedanta philosophy: That the universe is Pure Consciousness; Parama Purusha. Each one of us is a spark of that Cosmic Consciousness, not unlike a mug of water from the expanse of the ocean. What a magnificent idea/vision! Peace! 30 Sept 2019
